content.description: Climb up a series of jugs to a highball top out. Excellent piece of rock!
content.protection: Pad and Spotters, best not to fall tho.
content.location: Amazing tower feature across from the tiger wall.

content.description: Squat start on right hand crimp and left hand sloper undercling - make compression moves to a difficult stab to a decent edge. Climb straight up through an awesome sloper to good holds as you pull over onto the slab. Probably the purest line on the wall.
content.location: Just right of center- same start as Black Panther

content.description: Sit start on opposing holds in the red streak, cruise through tacky crimps to a difficult deadpoint below the roof, traverse right to finish
content.location: Dead Center of the Tiger stripe wall.

content.description: Start low on the left arete of the Tiger Wall, Climb up and right using compression to reach a positive matchable edge. From here, continue out the committing steep prow via long reaches on decent holds. Top out is easy. This boulder problem is named after Joe Baauw, who was affectionately nicknamed "Man Hands". Rest in peace Joe, you were an outstanding human.
content.location: Left arete of the Tiger wall in between F.R.O.W. and Red Dragon. I did not use the left wall at all but even if you did, I don't think it would change the difficulty very much.

content.description: Start under and left of the roof crack. Follow a series of crimps to underclings, gain a chockstone and pull through to top it out.
content.location: Left side of Tiger Wall, Follows large crack with a chockstone.

content.description:
Sit start on good holds, trend up and right to a decent ledge, climb left to a signature toss to good holds near the lip. classic Video Beta:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EQh_WXzIe4Y&t=8s
Beautifully streaked Orange and black wall with aesthetic lines.
